text.0:
A tweeted image claiming to show National Unity Platform’s (NUP) supporters setting fire to a police post in Uganda is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:camera_with_flash: The image was taken during the 2009 riots in Buganda: https://t.co/QByWYR1iLB
text.1:
:police_car_light: HOAX: A tweet claiming that former US President Barack Obama has endorsed Bobi Wine, an opposition leader in Uganda, is fake.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: No such endorsement appears on any of his official media accounts: https://t.co/IRIMbdvPLb
text.2:
:police_car_light: HOAX: A Facebook post advertising various jobs at the Uganda National Oil Company is fake.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: The company says it is not recruiting at the moment: https://t.co/VChdM253uP
text.3:
:police_car_light: HOAX: A Facebook post promoting a recruitment drive by Quickmart Supermarkets is fake.

:warning_selector: The retailer says it is not filling vacancies at the moment: https://t.co/pdteKi5i4n
text.4:
:police_car_light: HOAX: A Facebook post from an account bearing the name and image of Kenya’s First Lady, Margaret Kenyatta, and offering KSh 20,000 in celebration of her birthday is fake.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: State House has disowned both the page and the giveaway: https://t.co/S0C0U88ly2
text.5:
An article claiming that the US government has stopped Covid-19 relief to Uganda after President Donald Trump said he "can’t fund a dictator" is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:page_facing_up: The article distorts a statement from the US embassy in Uganda: https://t.co/5w78GnRmCo
text.6:
A photo shared on Facebook claiming to show the MP of Kenya's Suba South constituency, John Mbadi, being chased by an angry mob on October 30 in Mombasa is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:camera_with_flash: That photo of Mr Mbadi is more than two years old, and was taken in Nairobi: https://t.co/17bUJ0cJNx
